Name: rm
Description: The command removes specified non-directory type files from the system.

Arguments.Description: Allows removal of non-directory type files with various options for confirmation and handling different scenarios.

Arguments.Name: f
Arguments.Description: Attempt to remove files without prompting for confirmation, regardless of file permissions or existence.

Arguments.Name: i
Arguments.Description: Request confirmation before attempting to remove each file, regardless of the file's permissions or whether the standard input device is a terminal.

Arguments.Name: d
Arguments.Description: Attempt to remove directories as well as other types of files.

Arguments.Name: I
Arguments.Description: Request confirmation once if more than three files are being removed or if a directory is being recursively removed.

Arguments.Name: P
Arguments.Description: The `-P` argument does not have any effect in the `rm` command as of FreeBSD 13 and may be removed in the future.

Arguments.Name: R
Arguments.Description: Attempt to remove the file hierarchy rooted in each specified file argument.

Arguments.Name: r
Arguments.Description: The `-r` argument recursively removes the file hierarchy rooted in each file argument.

Arguments.Name: v
Arguments.Description: The `-v` argument displays files as they are being removed.

Arguments.Name: W
Arguments.Description: The `-W` argument attempts to undelete named files, primarily for files covered by whiteouts in a union file system.

Arguments.Name: x
Arguments.Description: The `-x` argument prevents the removal of files across mount points.
The command removes directory entries and non-directory type files specified on the command line.

Arguments.Name: pathname
Arguments.Description: The path argument passed to the command specifies the files or directories to be removed.
